instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SPI_MLB_MOSI: What is SPI_MLB_MOSI? SPI_MLB_MOSI is a line between the SPI ROM BIOS chip and resistors that sit between it and the PCH. This often corrodes on Macbook Airs due to liquid damage and results in missing PM_SLP_S4_L and no bootup..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message:
Hello,

I received this MacBook. It was liquid damaged. Around the SMC (smc should be fine, this one has the underfill around the SMC).
No corrosion! Liquid damage around the LPC+SPI connector. I removed the connector before ultrasonic cleaning. I cleaned the 
board, but still does not chime. 

<SIGNAL>SPI_MLB_CLK</SIGNAL> is missing. After a few second it comes on, but stays at 0V.
Also <SIGNAL>SPI_MLB_MOSI</SIGNAL> is missing. Is this a dead PCH? I know this could be SMC too, but how to find it out?
I hate changing things especially if it's a BGA.

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message: Check the resistors in the SPI lines. Check the voltage on Y2605

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message:
On Y2605 I've 0.8V and I can see it's oscillating.

I checked the resistors and all are good. 
I tried different BIOS, same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message: This is probably PCH issue, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message: It could be many things, does the board stay on and is CPU Vcore present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message:
Yes, the board stays on and the CPU Vcore is present. It's 0.9V.
CPU gets pretty hot after a while. PCH hot from the beginning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message: USB mouse lighting up? If not it will probably be corrosion under the SMC or any other BGA where liquid came close. Flux and some heat, NOT reflow!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime :(
threads.message: No, USB mouse does not light up. I did some heat and flux on SMC,PCH,CPU. Nothing really happened.
